series_title: Active Insurance Company Records - Insurance Companies. Rate Service Organizations and Residual Markets
series_description: This series documents consists of insurance company, rate service organization and Residual Market records. This series includes but is not limited to rules, rates, and forms submitted for compliance with Title 38.2 of the
retention_statement: ". Retain in agency until superseded then transfer to record series XXXXXX," Materials from Insurance Companies" or XXXXXX, Materials from Rate service Organizations and Residual Markets

series_description: This series documents insurance company requests for a rate in excess of the filed rate due to unspecified circumstances and documents State Corporation Commission approval of those rates in accordance with §§ 38.2-1920 and 2013 of the
retention_statement: Retain 3 years after rate approved then destroy.

series_description: This series documents the disapproval of insurance company submissions by the Commission.
retention_statement: Retain 2 years after disapproval then destroy.

series_description: This series consists of dormant records of insurance companies. This series includes but is not limited to: correspondence, inactive or obsolete rules, rates, forms and other supplementary documentation submitted by insurers that are at least 5 years old but have not been formally superseded by the insurers. These materials are used for reference purposes.
retention_statement: Retain 5 years from the end of the calendar year after becoming inactive then destroy.

series_title: Inactive Insurance Company Records - Insurance Companies, Rate Service Organizations and Residual Markets
series_description: This series consists of inactive records from insurance companies, rate service organization and Residual Markets. This series includes but is not limited to documents submitted by entities whose licenses have been withdrawn or revoked and remaining materials from the non-surviving entity after a merger
retention_statement: Retain 2 years from the end of the calendar year after becoming inactive then destroy.

series_title: Licensing Materials for Rate Service Organizations and Joint Underwriting Organizations or Associations
series_description: This series consists of compliance documents (licensing materials) by Rate Service Organizations and Joint Underwriting Organizations/Associations: This series includes but is not limited to inactive or replaced compliance documents submitted under the provisions of §§ 38.2-1914, 38.2-1915 and 38.2-2002 of the
retention_statement: Retain 1 year from the end of the calendar year after becoming obsolete then destroy.

series_title: Materials from Insurance Companies This series consist of rules, rates, and forms submitted by insurance companies.
retention_statement: Retain 3 years after superseded then destroy.

series_title: Materials from Rate Service Organziations and Residual Markets This series consist of Rate Service Organization and Residual Market submissions.
retention_statement: Retain 11 years after superseded or disapproved then destroy.

series_description: This series documents fines, payment and settlements of penalties against insurers imposed by the Commission under the provisions of § 38.2-218 of the
retention_statement: Retain 5 years after final acceptance or refusal, then destroy.
legal_citation: Code of Virginia. Includes settlements, agreements, copies of checks and related correspondence.

series_title: Statistical Records from Rate Service Organizations: Non NCCI (National Council of Compensation Insurers)
series_description: This series consists of statistical records from Rate Service Organizations(non NCCI). This series includes but is not limited to superseded statistical information and compilations submitted under the provisions of sections 38.2-1919 and 38.2-2012
retention_statement: Retain 3 years after superseded then destroy.

series_description: This series documents distributions of funds to insurers. DMV collects a fee charged to uninsured motorists and the Commission distributes the fees to insurers under the provisions of
retention_statement: Retain 5 years after distribution or completion of audit, whichever is greater, then destroy.

series_title: Virginia Property Insurance Association (VPIA) Declination Reports
series_description: This series consists of VPIA declination of individuals requests for coverage. This series includes but is not limited to reports from VPIA declining coverage of property, theft or liability exposures due to risks that do not meet VPIA's eligibility criteria. Refer to
retention_statement: Retain 1 year from the of the calendar year after becoming obsolete then destroy in compliance with No. 8 on schedule cover page
